snippet: Residents outside the ring of levees that protect New Orleans want the federal government to erect walls to protect them, too, especially after Hurricane Isaac caused the river to overflow.
abstract: Louisiana residents outside the ring of levees that protect New Orleans want the federal government to erect walls to protect their communities as well; major financing for such efforts is not likely, however, for reasons having to do with the federal budget, Army Corps of Engineers priorities and the rigid cost-benefit analyses that such projects must undergo.

byline.original: By JOHN SCHWARTZ and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from LaPlace, La., and John Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: Residents outside the ring of levees that protect New Orleans want the federal government to erect walls to protect them, too, especially after Hurricane Isaac caused the river to overflow.

headline.seo: New Orleans Levees Hold, and Outsiders Want In
headline.main: New Orleans Levees Hold, and Outsiders Want In
headline.print_headline: As Levees Hold Up, Outsiders Want In
